summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to a judge (Nathan) regarding the case US v. Maxwell. It transmits a government letter requesting redactions to filings related to Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena, along with proposed redactions to filings from defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Addressee of the email, presumably Judge Alison J. Nathan presiding over US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the referenced criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email concerns redactions to filings related to her application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena.

events.title: Government Submits Redaction Request
events.description: The government files a letter and proposed redactions regarding filings related to Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17(c) subpoena application in her criminal case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney dated April 23, 2021.
It concerns the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The government is requesting redactions to filings related to Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena.
The proposed redactions apply to filings from both defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.
The correspondence indicates ongoing pre-trial litigation and discovery disputes in Maxwell's case.
